scope: TopicMode behavior only. Each mode defines title patterns + which body sections are eligible, plus practical writing guidance (goal/tone/focus).

ExplainGuide.goal: Explain the topic clearly, then guide the reader to a confident next step with practical decision criteria.
ExplainGuide.tone: Grounded, helpful, professional. No hype. Use gentle hedging and realistic ranges when relevant.
focus: Plain-language explanation + how it works in practice
Decision factors (cost, timeline, risk, maintenance, quality signals)
One honest comparison (DIY vs pro, basic vs premium, short-term vs long-term)
title_example: {Keyword}: what to expect, costs, and smarter choices
A practical guide to {Keyword} (without the sales pitch)
{Keyword} made simple: how it works, what matters, what to avoid

Comparison.goal: Help the reader choose between 2–3 clear options by showing trade-offs and best-fit scenarios.
Comparison.tone: Decision-support, calm, specific. Avoid definitive guarantees; recommend by scenario.
focus: Option A vs B vs C with trade-offs
Fit-by-scenario recommendations (budget, urgency, property type, constraints)
Make the comparison section the anchor of the body
title_example: {Keyword}: Option A vs Option B vs Option C
Comparing {Keyword} options: trade-offs, costs, and best-fit scenarios
{Keyword} vs {AltKeyword}: which makes sense for your situation?

ChecklistSteps.goal: Give the reader a clear set of steps/checklist items they can follow to reduce mistakes and surprises.
ChecklistSteps.tone: Practical, directive but not aggressive. Explain consequences without fear-mongering.
focus: Each step includes what/why/how + a short example
Call out what can go wrong if a step is skipped
title_example: The {Keyword} checklist: what to do before you commit
{N} steps to get {Keyword} right the first time
A practical {Keyword} checklist for fewer surprises

FAQDriven.goal: Answer the real questions people have, using natural question-style H2s, then close with the formal FAQ block.
focus: Use question-shaped H2s for key body sections (avoid 'What is X?' phrasing where possible)
Answer in short paragraphs with micro-scenarios
Avoid repeating body questions in the final FAQ block
title_example: {Keyword} questions people actually ask (with clear answers)
When does {Keyword} make sense? Answers to the real questions
{Keyword} explained through real scenarios and common questions

CaseStory.goal: Use a believable case narrative early to create clarity and trust, then generalize into guidance and next steps.
CaseStory.tone: Story-led but restrained; realistic timeline and outcomes; avoid dramatic language.
focus: Case study provides context (who, problem, approach, outcome, lesson)
Pull 3–5 lessons from the story (often via Section 14)
Connect outcomes back to decision criteria the reader can use
title_example: A real-world {Keyword} story: from problem to outcome
What changed after {Keyword} was done properly (a real case)

MistakesMyths.goal: Prevent costly errors by surfacing common mistakes and myths, then replace them with clear fixes.
focus: Each mistake/myth includes consequence + better alternative
Use 'hidden truths' to add insider realism when appropriate
End with practical fixes (often via Section 14)
title_example: Common {Keyword} mistakes (and what to do instead)
{Keyword} myths vs reality: what actually holds up

placeholders.N: An integer (usually 5–12) chosen by the engine when a numbered title is used.
placeholders.AltKeyword: Optional comparison keyword or close alternative, only when it reads naturally.
placeholders.ClientType: A realistic audience/client label derived from client profile (e.g., homeowner, clinic, property manager).
